isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Diagnostics Manual - Hard Start and No Start Diagnostics - Test Procedures - 10. Fuel Supply System

item.para: To check the fuel supply system for efficient engine operation
To check for fuel aeration
To check for fuel system contamination

note.para: Breaking any fuel system joints will induce air in the fuel system.

item.para: 0-160 psi gauge (on Gauge Bar Tool)
ICP System Test Adapter
In-line shut off valve
3/8 inch clear sample line
Clear container with a wide opening (approximately 1 liter or 1 quart US)

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, death, including damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.
To avoid personal injury or death, comply with the following:

item.para: Do not mix gasoline, gasohol or alcohol with diesel fuel. This practice creates a fire hazard and is potentially explosive.

Do not allow engine fluids to stay on your skin. Clean skin and nails with soap and water, or a good hand cleaner. Wash or properly dispose of clothing or rags containing engine fluids. Engine fluids contain elements that may be unhealthy for skin and could cause cancer.

note.para: Engine fluids, oil, fuel, and coolant, are a threat to the environment. Recycle or dispose of engine fluids according to local regulations. Never put engine fluids in the trash, on the ground, in sewers, or other bodies of water.

step1.para:
See " Appendix A: VT 275 Performance Specifications
" for fuel pump pressure specification and record on Diagnostic Form.
Verify there is fuel in the fuel tank(s). Check fuel in fuel tank(s) for odors other than diesel fuel, for example: kerosene, alcohol, or gasoline.

note.para: Low Biodiesel blends (up to 5%) should not cause engine or fuel system problems. If low biodiesel blends are used the odor in the fuel tank(s) may not match diesel fuel.

step1.para: Turn ignition switch to ON, listen for a hum coming from the fuel pump. The ECM turns fuel pump on, it should run for 60 seconds. After 60 seconds the ECM turns the fuel pump off unless the engine is running.

note.para: Engine may run without the fuel pump, but damage to the injectors could occur.

item.para: If the fuel pump can be heard running, continue with step 4.
If the fuel pump cannot be heard running, turn ignition switch to OFF.
Disconnect the fuel pump harness connector and measure voltage between the power and ground circuits.
Turn ignition switch to ON, battery voltage should be present for 60 seconds.

If battery voltage is not present, see " Fuel Pump Pin-Point Diagnostics
" in the " Electronic Control Systems Diagnostics" section of this manual, and see the applicable truck Circuit Diagram Manualfor relay and fuse locations.

step1.para: Turn ignition switch to OFF.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, use care to prevent contact with the door edge when the cab is up and the door is open.

step1.para: Remove air inlet duct on the engine to aid in plug removal and system testing.

caution.para: To avoid damage to the engine, take precautions to prevent foreign materials from entering the air intake system when the air inlet duct is removed.

note.para: When removing the test plug, there is a possibility of a small amount of fuel leaking out. Put in a drain pan or rag to collect this leakage. Collect and dispose of this fuel according to local regulations.

calloutgroup.callout1: Conditioned fuel to left cylinder head
Conditioned fuel to right cylinder head

step1.para: Remove plug from the fuel pressure test port plug at the bottom of the secondary fuel filter housing.

calloutgroup.callout1: Test fitting connection (remove to adapt to the ICP System Test Adapter)
ICP System Test Adapter (attached to test fitting connection)

figure.caption: ICP System Test Adapter installed with Fuel Pressure Gauge

step1.para: Install the ICP System Test Adapter and assemble and attach Fuel Pressure Gauge.

item.para: The Fuel Pressure Gauge is available through the tool supplier. It is recommend this tool be used for pressure and sampling.
If the Fuel Pressure Gauge can not be obtained. Test setup can be made using tools from the dealer supplied Essential Tool Kits .

step1.para: Run the clear test line to clear container
Turn ignition switch to ON (do not crank the engine).

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, death, including damage to the engine or vehicle:

item.para: Dispose of fuel according to local regulations in the correct container clearly marked DIESEL FUEL.
DO NOT smoke.
Keep away from open flames and sparks.

step1.para: Open the in-line shut off valve, drain sample in the clear container. As filling, observe the clear test line for indication of air bubbles.

note.para: Breaking any fuel system joints will induce air in the fuel system, it should clear shortly.

step1.para: Close in-line shut off valve.
Check for contamination and record results on Diagnostics Form.

table.title: Sample should be clear, free of debris, water and other contaminates. Sample should not be cloudy or dyed (blue or red).

entry.para: If air bubbles stop with sample flowing, the fuel is not aerated and if there is no contamination, continue with step 15.
If the air bubbles do not clear before the sample container is almost full, a second sample needs to be taken to determine if air bubbles have cleared, continue with step 13.

If fuel is contaminated with water, debris or other contaminates, take a second sample. Some sediment and water may be present in the fuel sample if the fuel filter has not been replaced for a prolonged period of time or if the sediment and water have not been drained recently, continue with step 13.

If the fuel sample is cloudy in colder temperatures, this indicates waxing or gelling. Summer fuels are not suitable in colder temperatures. Change to the recommended fuel grade. See "Fuel Requirements" in the Engine Operation and Maintenance Manual(for engine's model number and model year).

If the fuel sample is dyed, either blue or red, this indicates off-road use fuel and could cause a performance problem. Change to a recommended fuel grade. See "Fuel Requirements" in the Engine Operation and Maintenance Manual (for engine's model number and model year).

step1.para: If a second sample is needed, cycle the ignition switch to restart the fuel pump, drain sample and check for air bubbles and contamination in the fuel.
Record the results on the Diagnostic Form.

entry.para: If air bubbles did not clear, check the fuel supply system from the fuel tank(s) to the HFCM inlet for leaks. Correct the condition and retest. The check should include wiggling all fuel line connections, checking the primary fuel filter cover and the HFCM drain plug for leaks with the fuel pump turned off. With the fuel pump off, the primary fuel filter cover and the drain plug may show a slow drip of fuel indicating cover or plug is loose or seals are worn, cracked, or broken.

Excessive water or contaminants may indicate that the tank and fuel system may need to be flushed and cleaned. Take a sample from the HFCM drain plug for verification. See " Drain Water from HFCM
" in the " Engine Symptoms Diagnostics
" section of this manual.
If fuel doesn't clear up, the system may have to be flushed to correct the condition. Replace the primary and secondary fuel filters and verify fuel is the recommended grade and clean.

note.para: Any residue or microbial growth in the tank(s) will compound with the use of biodiesel. This can cause serious plugging of filters and deposits in the fuel system. Fuel tanks should be thoroughly cleaned and dried before operating with any biodiesel blends. Adding biocides will help minimize growth.

step1.para: Cycle ignition switch to OFF and back to ON.
Check fuel pressure on the fuel pressure gauge when the pump starts. Pressure should increase to specification quickly.
Turn ignition switch to OFF.
Record the results on the Diagnostic Form.

item.para:
If fuel pressure is within specification, do " Test 11. Main Power Relay Voltage to ECM
" in this section.
If fuel pressure is below specification, replace both the primary and secondary fuel filters and retest.

If fuel pressure is still below specification, after replacing both primary and secondary fuel filters, measure fuel pump discharge pressure. Do " Test 10.2. Fuel Pump Discharge Pressure " in this section.

svcsubproc.title: 10.2. Fuel Pump Discharge Pressure

note.para: This procedure should only be performed when directed by " Test 10.1. Pressure, Quality, and Aerated Fuel " when fuel pressure is still below specification or slow to build, after replacing both primary and secondary fuel filters.

svcsubproc.para: To measure fuel pump discharge pressure

note.para: Breaking any fuel system joints will induce air in the fuel system.

item.para: 0-160 psi gauge (on Gauge Bar Tool)
Fuel Pressure Test Adapter

note.para: When removing the banjo bolt, fuel will leak out. Put in a suitable container to collect this leakage. Collect and dispose of this fuel according to local regulations.

calloutgroup.callout1: Conditioned fuel to left cylinder head
Conditioned fuel to right cylinder head

step1.para: Remove the banjo bolt from fuel supply from fuel pump (item 2) at the bottom of the secondary fuel filter housing.

note.para: Use existing copper gaskets for testing. Replace the copper gaskets on the banjo bolt when testing is over and repairs have been made.

figure.caption: Fuel Pressure Test Adapter installed in fuel supply from fuel pump

step1.para: Connect the Fuel Pressure Test Adapter to the fuel supply, using the banjo bolt and copper gaskets.
Connect the Fuel Pressure Gauge to the Fuel Pressure Test Adapter.
Turn ignition switch to ON (do not crank the engine).
Check fuel pressure on the test gauge immediately when the pump starts. The fuel pressure should increase to specification quickly.

caution.para: To prevent possible fire and damage to the engine from leaking fuel, replace the two copper gaskets when reattaching fuel supply from the HFCM to the secondary fuel filter housing.

step1.para: Record the results on the Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If the discharge pressure is within specification, turn ignition switch to OFF, continue with step 7.

If the discharge pressure is not within specifications, turn ignition switch to OFF. Reconnect the fuel line and banjo bolt to the secondary fuel filter housing, do " Test 10.3. Fuel Inlet Restriction " in this section.

step1.para: Remove the Fuel Pressure Test Adapter.
Remove, clean, and inspect the fuel pressure regulator, see the Engine Service Manual.
After reinstallation of the secondary fuel filter housing and all fuel line. Attach the filter pressure gauge to the secondary fuel filter test port, and retest fuel pressure.

svcsubproc.title: 10.3. Fuel Inlet Restriction

note.para: This procedure should only be performed when directed by " Test 10.2. Fuel Pump Discharge Pressure " when discharge pressure is within specification or slow to build.

svcsubproc.para: To measure fuel pump inlet restriction

note.para: Breaking any fuel system joints will induce air in the fuel system.

item.para: 0-30 in Hg gauge (on gauge bar tool)
Fuel Inlet Restriction Adapter
In-line shut off valve

step1.para: Put a clean flat drain pan under the HFCM drain plug
Wipe down the frame around and under the drain plug. Wipe down the HFCM area around the drain plug also.
Open the drain plug and drain the HFCM to flat drain pan.

note.para: When removing the drain plug fuel will leak out. Collect and dispose of this fuel according to local regulations.

step1.para: Remove the HFCM drain plug, install the fuel inlet restriction adapter, hand tighten only.

note.para: Inspect the drain plug O-ring for damage from removal. Care must be taken when installing drain plug to prevent damaging the O-ring.

step1.para: Connect to 0-30 in Hg gauge on the gauge bar tool through an in-line shut off valve. Make sure the shut off valve is in the closed position.

note.para: The fuel pump runs for 60 seconds when ignition switch is turned on. The in-line shut off valve must be closed before the fuel pump shuts off. This will prevent the gauge from filling with fuel.

step1.para: Turn ignition switch to ON. Open the in-line shut off valve and check for restriction indication on the test gauge. Close the in-line shut off valve. Turn ignition switch to OFF.
Record results on Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If vacuum indication is above the specification, check for restrictions in the fuel supply lines from the fuel pickup tube in the fuel tank to the HFCM. Visually inspect for bent, crimped, or damaged fuel supply lines and connections from the fuel tank(s) to the HFCM. Correct any restrictions and retest fuel pressure at the secondary fuel filter housing test port.
If vacuum indication is below the specification and fuel pump discharge pressure is low, replace the fuel pump and retest fuel pressure at the secondary fuel filter housing test port.
